message: @lastkarrde I know right?

Yea... warpgate play is seeming a bit strong in all matchups right now
that guys FF placement is freaky good
Wish it was a closer series but it was still awesome

Ya, his FF placements were perfect.. but what could July do? Hydras are too slow off creep, lings get FF'ed away, roaches dont have the range, infestors would be useless, mutas are too expensive and a static/defensive/spine crawler strat by July could easily be blinked around.
I feel like he could have stayed defensive & on creep once he got hydras up and expanded.  He also didn't get hydra range.  What do I know though haha he's julyzerg

Definitely a disappointing finals for the Zerg fans out there.  I think it's easy to blame it on Protoss being "OP" -- watching those games, it was hard to separate that from the fact that MC is just an amazing player.
Perceived race imbalance aside, I'd just like to see the next finals be more evenly matched -- the last few finals have been total washouts.
What league/points are you? And what sort of strats do you lose to? (timing pushes, 4gates, macro games)
that said, it's also quite possible that zerg players will figure out how to counter this on their own
And forcefield can continually split the opponents army
well i think there has to be a balance between the races in matches between average players, and in matches between gosus
I wouldn't say never lose... but yeah. those builds are looking pretty tough
bit late tonight though ^^
Im thinking blizzard will make FF cost 75 or 100 energy.. or make hydras fast again (like in SC1)
Hydra range is ok.. good enough to deal with forcefields
yeah, agreed. You could tell July was trying, and has a high skill level
or maybe increase their range?
colossi, force fields, storm are awesome
there shouldn't be anyone able to use an ability in the game SO WELL THAT it's nearly impossible to fight against
so we should probably give it some time and see how things develop before asking blizzard to nerf it
yeah
and its tough to get a disproportionately strong army against a fucking pro haha
even if you are a pro
it's quite possible that FF is imba and that pro toss players, once they figure things out a bit more, will never lose to pro zerg players in standard play
the finals were disappointing because of how overwhelmingly strong the toss army was
i think you have to have a disproportionately strong army to combat FF
your armies will cost relatively the same
terran can at least get EMP, stim, medivacs, tanks, etc pretty early on
if they make hydras fast they might have to nerf their damage
they're super strong right now
and consistently beat zerg and other terran
the thing about toss is, whether you're zerg or terran, it takes ridics micro to beat them
they used to be my easiest matchup too
and have better ghost micro
storm is too deadly otherwise
so my apm & macro is good compared to others at my level. I try and play macro games.. don't know any good timings like MC lol
even if they get split into a line, because of the DPS they still do "enough"
i lose most of my games to toss, ugh
3400 points, #1 diamond
i lose to pretty much any toss player at my level
i need to do more drops, etc
